oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Gene Autry at the Melody Ranch - 1949-06-04
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Gene Autry on the Melody Ranch. The session is hosted by Charles Lyon (entertainer). The recording is from June 04, 1949. The recording was created by CBS Studios. The cast features Gene Autry (musician), Johnny Bond (entertainer), Pat Buttram (entertainer), the Cass Country Boys (musicial group), Pinafores (musicial group), and Carl Cotner and his Band (musicial group).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Gene Autry; Johnny Bond; Pat Buttram; Cass Country Boys; Pinafores; Carl Cotner; Charles Lyon
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) I'm Back in the Saddle Again [featuring Charles Lyon voiceover][incomplete] (Gene Autry) -- (00:32) Charles Lyon performs the Melody Ranch introduction -- (00:51) Cowboy Blues (Gene Autry) -- (02:13) Gene Autry introduces the audience to the Melody Ranch while performing a Double Mint Gum radio spot -- (02:49) Streets of Laredo (Gene Autry) -- (05:19) Autry and Johnny Bond perform a skit about Bond asking Autry to invest in his business -- (07:35) Then You'll Know What it Means (Pinafores) -- (09:13) Autry thanks the Pinafores; additionally, Autry and Pat Buttram perform a skit about Buttram's talking duck -- (11:46) A Boy From Texas (Gene) -- (12:58) Autry, Bond, and Buttram recreate a dramatic story set in Chicago -- (14:12) Autry and an unidentified female performs the vocal script of a letter for the story -- (14:48) Autry and Bond discuss going to visit Autry's aunt -- (15:05) Unidentified tune (Carl Cotner and Band) -- (15:13) Autry introduces a scene with Autry and Bond meeting Aunt Martha -- (19:32) Sat in Hay (Unconfirmed) [featuring Gene Autry voiceover about living with Aunt Martha] (Carl Cotner and Band) -- (20:03) Bond, Autry, and others performs a scene about riding -- (20:34) Unidentified tune (Carl Cotner and Band) -- (20:43) Bond, Autry, and others performs a scene about riding and a lost dog -- (22:39) Unidentified tune (Carl Cotner and Band) -- (22:51) Bond, Autry, and others performs a scene about a lost dog and Aunt Martha's will -- (24:16) Old Faithful [featuring Gene Autry reflecting on what makes a 'cowboy classic'] (Gene Autry) -- (27:58) Autry performs a Double Mint Gum radio spot while saying goodbye to the audience -- (28:31) Back in the Saddle Again [featuring Charles Lyon outro voiceover] (Gene Autry)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Autry, Gene, 1907-1998; Bond, Johnny; Bond, Johnny, 1915-1978; Buttram, Pat; Cass County Boys (Musical group); Cotner, Carl; Lyon, Charles, 1903-1985;
